item.title: Household dump, 18th June
item.description:
People are gross and leaving their crap all over the street

item.title: Alleyway of back of Kingswood Close BR6 8PA there are numerous items left I, 18th June
item.description:
There are numerous dustbins abandoned, children toys, glass chest drawers, builders rabble, garden waste, food waste and very smelly etc It is very difficult to get my garden recycling bin out and your dustmen straggler as well, it smells in the summer, specially dustbins full of water with dead animals in it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Council bin, Bexley rd jct Limewood Rd, 18th June
item.description:
Black refuse bag dumped on the pavement by the council bin near Acorn estate on Bexley rd, junction of Limewood Rd. With the heatwave the flytipping is producing a terrible pungent smell that's attracting not only foxes & rodents but flies & ants.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bexley Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox, 18th June
item.description:

item.title: Large pothole/trench and surface disintegrating, 18th June
item.description:
The pothole/trench is continuing to increase in size and the road is disintegrating resulting in debris being strewn onto the path and neighbouring properties. It's not only a matter of time before this is going to cause damage to property or person. The road itself is so dangerous as a driver there is no way of avoiding the huge trench that is in the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mayplace Road East, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet
